title: Test
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall GDP growth compared to previous year has increased over the Year

GDP growth compared to previous year is gradually increasing from 2011 to 2012, rapidly decreasing from 2012 to 2013, rapidly increasing from 2013 to 2016, roughly constant from 2016 to 2018, rapidly increasing from 2018 to 2019, and lastly rapidly decreasing from 2019 to 2021.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2019 and 2020.
Max GDP growth compared to previous year about 35.0 was recorded at Year 2019
Min GDP growth compared to previous year about 1.34 was recorded at Year 2013
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2013 to 2016.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2019 to 2021.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2017 to 2019.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2011 to 2013.
But, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2016 to 2017.
